TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ToolBarState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the visual state of a toolbar item that is drawn with visual styles.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ToolBarState> values correspond to the states of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> objects exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.Button>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.DropDownButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButton>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown> classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ToolBarState Checked = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The item is in the checked state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ToolBarState Disabled = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The item is in the disabled state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ToolBarState Hot = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The item is in the hot state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ToolBarState HotChecked = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The item is in the hot and checked states.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ToolBarState Normal = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The item is in the normal state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ToolBarState Pressed = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The item is in the pressed state.
